text: Tore Blom before 1935 Tore Blom (Teodor Blom; April 23, 1880 – September 24, 1961) was a Swedish track and field athlete who competed at the 1900 Summer Olympics in Paris, France. Blom competed in the long jump and the high jump. In the former he placed eleventh of twelve with a distance of 5.770 metres while in the latter he took last of eight jumpers clearing 1.50 metres. ==References== * De Wael, Herman. Herman's Full Olympians: "Athletics 1900". Accessed 18 March 2006.
